bibl.title: Letter from J. F. Siler to Sidney Wallach, September 12, 1950

div1.p: Siler tells Wallach that the death of Kean, who was President of the Walter Reed Memorial Association, makes it impossible for him at the present time to state when the Association can have a conference with him concerning a commemorative program for Reed.

div1.head: Letter from J. F. Siler to Sidney Wallach, September 12, 1950
div1.opener:
2220 - 20th Street, N. W.,
Washington 9, D. C.,
September 12, 1950.
Mr. Sidney Wallach
The Sidney Wallach Associates
381 Fourth Avenue
New York 16, N. Y.
My dear Mr. Wallach:
div1.p:
Permit me to acknowledge receipt of your letter of August 28th and to
express my apology for not having answered it ere this. Soon after its
receipt I planned to take the matter up with General Kean, President of the
Walter Reed Memorial Association, when he became ill. I am sorry to say that
he died about a week ago and was buried at Monticello last Thursday.

In view of the existing conditions it will not be possible for me at the
present time to advise you as to when the members of the Walter Reed Memorial
Association can have a conference with you concerning the possibility of
organizing a commemorative program for Walter Reed. We usually have our annual
meeting in the latter part of November and it may be possible to arrange for
a conference at that time. I shall be glad to advise you later concerning this
matters.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, J. F. Siler (sgd)
Col., (MC), U.S.A., Retired
Secretary, Walter Reed Memorial
Association jfs k
